entry.title: Tests are failing: trace_event_unittest.cc(1980): Value of: dict\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): trace_event_unittest.cc(1980): Value of: dict\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://base:base_unittests/TraceEventTestFixture.PrimitiveArgs - ninja://base:base_unittests/TraceEventTestFixture.ConvertableTypes
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/b8457f23f94e35238eb78bf8079b5364
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: [Skia] Scrolling and window dragging is laggy
entry.content:
macOS 14.3.1 MacBook Air M1 Canary Version 123.0.6304.0
STR: 1.) Visit https://stadt-bremerhaven.de/ 2.) Scroll down and up again to the top of the page 3.) Or drag the window
Actual: Scrolling and window dragging is laggy.
Expected: Smooth Scrolling and smooth window dragging.
Try step 1-3 with chrome://flags/#skia-graphite disabled: No issue.
Thanks for checking.

entry.title: Tests are failing: web_request_apitest.cc(2006): Value of: RunTest(\"test_webtransport.html\")\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): web_request_apitest.cc(2006): Value of: RunTest(\"test_webtransport.html\")\n Actual: false\nExpected: true
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/test:browser_tests/ExtensionWebRequestApiWebTransportTest.Main

entry.title: Bling First Few Runs Gestural IPH v1.0 - UI Bugs
entry.content:
Link to implementation deck with specs: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1fJDe4OjB7SZeHbpcLTLk3bUMw2CUfw5aQ3RlkjtpmNQ/edit?pli=1&resourcekey=0-KTzrW2HZVWIsE4VomSxDig#slide=id.g269353b7910_0_246
[P2] The cursor of Swipe Back / Forward should begin at a position closer to the edge, since the gesture doesn’t really work if you swipe from the middle of the screen. [P2] When in landscape, the IPH of Swipe Back / Forward is too close to the edge and thus hidden beneath the notch (dynamic island) [P2] When in landscape, the IPH of Swipe Right for Incognito is too close to the edge and thus hidden beneath the notch (dynamic island) [P2] For all IPHs, the colors should be updated when in dark mode [P2] The colors of Swipe Right for Incognito should be always in dark mode [P3] For all IPHs, the cursor should be less transparent (suggest to try 60% or 70% opacity). [P3] The style of the “Dismiss” button should be updated [P3] The IPH of Swipe Right for Incognito should be vertically centered on the screen. Right now it’s positioned too low and it’s too close to the cursor

entry.title: linux-lacros-asan-lsan-rel browser_tests failures related to Wayland display connection
entry.content:
During the Chromium Gardener shift I noticed a lot of failures going on with this bot with the error message: [wayland_connection.cc(200)] Failed to connect to Wayland display: Connection refused (111)
An example set of failing run can be seen here: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-lacros-asan-lsan-rel/8373/overview
svenzheng@ mentioned there may have been a wayland related reland yesterday which might be related and that jennyz@ may have more context?

entry.title: Implement BackButtonResult.ResultType.MOVE_TO_PREVIOUS
entry.content:
MOVE_TO_PREVIOUS should go back to the previous active TransitStation.
There's a challenge because the station either has to: 1. Be copied 2. Be cleaned up for reuse and non-linear paths through station instances have to be supported

entry.title: Dawn info collection no longer reports enabled toggles
entry.content:
This is a regression. Go to chrome://gpu/ and look in the "Dawn info" section.
On mac, 121.0.6167.160, you can see a list of toggle names in [Enabled Toggle Names] subsection.
In canary, 123.0.6304.0 the entire toggle section is blank. You see [Enabled Toggle Names], but nothing inside.

entry.title: base::DIR_SYSTEM path service returns incorrect case for path on Windows
entry.content:
calling `base::PathService::Get` with `base::DIR_SYSTEM` returns the value `C:\Windows\system32` on my system, and yet the path name is in fact `C:\Windows\System32` as can be checked by calling `QueryFullProcessImageName` on a running process in this directory, and also inspection of the directory manually.
``` c:\>dir c:\windows\sys* Volume in drive C is XX Volume Serial Number is 1234
Directory of c:\windows
2019-12-07 01:14 <DIR> System 2019-12-07 01:12 219 system.ini 2024-02-16 11:01 <DIR> System32 <-- Capital S. 2022-12-15 10:49 <DIR> SystemApps 2024-02-14 11:14 <DIR> SystemResources 2024-02-16 10:50 <DIR> SystemTemp 2024-02-14 11:14 <DIR> SysWOW64 ```

entry.title: Implement BackButtonResult.ResultType.EXIT_FACILITY
entry.content: One common way to handle a back press is to close a dialog/menu; support this in BackButtonResult.

entry.title: Create a state to represent a paused app
entry.content:
Might be modeling it as a TransitStation makes sense.
Add it to BackButtonResult and add a pressBackToPauseApp() to TransitStation.

entry.title: Multiple clang-tidy checks miss use-after-forward
entry.content:
Upstream bugs: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/82023 https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/issues/82028
Real case in Chromium that would have been caught by these: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5300959

entry.title: Tab title is not set for full-page PDF
entry.content:
For full-page PDFs, the tab title is not being set. The title should be set by the PDF metadata.
Repro steps: 1. Enable OOPIF PDF in chrome://flags. 2. Navigate to https://www.pdf995.com/samples/pdf.pdf.
Expected result: Tab title is "PDF", a title set by the PDF metadata.
Actual result: Tab title is "pdf995.com/samples/pdf.pdf".

entry.title: CHECK failure: false. Mismatch; class=LayoutText stored in inline_items_builder.cc
entry.content:
Detailed Report: https://clusterfuzz.com/testcase?key=5113503368544256
Fuzzer: j00ru_htmlcss_fuzz Job Type: windows_asan_chrome Platform Id: windows
Crash Type: CHECK failure Crash Address: Crash State: false. Mismatch; class=LayoutText stored in inline_items_builder.cc
Sanitizer: address (ASAN)
Regressed: https://clusterfuzz.com/revisions?job=windows_asan_chrome&range=1261531:1261532
Reproducer Testcase: https://clusterfuzz.com/download?testcase_id=5113503368544256
Issue filed automatically.

entry.title: virtual/pna-workers-disabled/external/wpt/fetch/private-network-access/worker-fetch.tentative.window.html test is flaky
entry.content:
virtual/pna-workers-disabled/external/wpt/fetch/private-network-access/worker-fetch.tentative.window.html
Timeout Failure on mac11-arm64-rel-tests
Test History Link: mac11-arm64-rel-tests: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium%3Aci/ninja%3A%2F%2F%3Ablink_wpt_tests%2Fvirtual%2Fpna-workers-disabled%2Fexternal%2Fwpt%2Ffetch%2Fprivate-network-access%2Fworker-fetch.tentative.window.html?q=VHASH%3A5ce217da20a31a0b
Dashboard: https://data.corp.google.com/sites/chrome_generic_flakiness_dashboard_datasite/top_flakes/?f=test_id:eq:ninja:%2F%2F:blink_wpt_tests%2Fvirtual%2Fpna-workers-disabled%2Fexternal%2Fwpt%2Ffetch%2Fprivate-network-access%2Fworker-fetch.tentative.window.html&f=realm:in:(null)&f=variant_test_suite:in:blink_wpt_tests&can=2 and average 3.59% flaky rate in runs mostly on Mac builders

entry.title: Shadow-dom: Support for additional accessibility features such as increasing global line-height and letter-spacing
entry.content:
Currently it is possible to increase the global font size via browser settings but it is not currently possible to modify the global letter-spacing or line-height as described in the w3c success criteria SC 1.4.12: https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/text-spacing.html
Current workarounds using broswer extensions that modify global CSS do not work when text is rendered inside the shadow dom.

entry.title: Hang preventing restart from service worker logging
entry.content:
macOS 14.3, Chrome 123.0.6304.0
I was restarting to take the 14.3 update and the restart couldn't proceed due to hung Chrome. Symbolized sample attached, most relevantly:
``` + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | 921 content::ServiceWorkerVersion::OnReportConsoleMessage(blink::mojom::ConsoleMessageSource, blink::mojom::ConsoleMessageLevel, std::__Cr::basic_string<char16_t, std::__Cr::char_traits<char16_t>, std::__Cr::allocator<char16_t>> const&, int, GURL const&) (in Google Chrome Framework) + 57184490 [observer_list_internal.h:158] + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + 382 content::ServiceWorkerContextCore::OnReportConsoleMessage(content::ServiceWorkerVersion*, blink::mojom::ConsoleMessageSource, blink::mojom::ConsoleMessageLevel, std::__Cr::basic_string<char16_t, std::__Cr::char_traits<char16_t>, std::__Cr::allocator<char16_t>> const&, int, GURL const&) (in Google Chrome Framework) + 56519431 [string:1789] + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! 255 content::LogConsoleMessage(blink::mojom::ConsoleMessageLevel, std::__Cr::basic_string<char16_t, std::__Cr::char_traits<char16_t>, std::__Cr::allocator<char16_t>> const&, int, bool, bool, std::__Cr::basic_string<char16_t, std::__Cr::char_traits<char16_t>, std::__Cr::allocator<char16_t>> const&) (in Google Chrome Framework) + 53009566 [logging.h:605] + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : 40 logging::LogMessage::Init(char const*, int) (in Google Chrome Framework) + 91189666 [iomanip:151] + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | 29 localtime_r (in libsystem_c.dylib) + 41 [0x7ff80b05f6b9] + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + 26 tzsetwall_basic (in libsystem_c.dylib) + 54 [0x7ff80b05f9a2] + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! 26 notify_check_tz (in libsystem_c.dylib) + 32 [0x7ff80b05fb2e] + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! 11 notify_check (in libsystem_notify.dylib) + 359 [0x7ff80e8016e8] + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : | + ! : 4 ??? (in libsystem_notify.dylib) load address 0x7ff80e800000 + 0x5fd5 [0x7ff80e805fd5] ```

entry.title: Add comma to privacy pass header
entry.content: The privacy pass token format is being updated to add a comma between the token and extensions field, so we should update Chrome accordingly (assuming this lands as it currently is: https://github.com/chris-wood/draft-wood-privacypass-auth-scheme-extensions/pull/6)

entry.title: WebAppSettings prevent_close_after_run_on_os_login policy works only on ChromeOS
entry.content: prevent_close_after_run_on_os_login is only functional on ChromeOS, and the description should be explicit about it. https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/policy/resources/templates/policy_definitions/Miscellaneous/WebAppSettings.yaml;drc=81fb5b439c936f5f73937d6d65e7a2a43033c425;l=7

entry.title: Chrome not making any network requests to "storage.googleapis.com" domain
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Download the file vendor-logo.zip from https://drive.google.com/file/d/1K-0tenB9uW_0XAh656h0CW2kwUnuegTv/view and unzip it
2. Open the chrome from command line passing the `--user-data-dir` flag pointing to this directory. Make sure to pass the absolute path eg on Mac `/Applications/Google\ Chrome.app/Contents/MacOS/Google\ Chrome --user-data-dir=/Users/<userName>/Downloads/vendor-logo`
3. To verify whether this data directory is actually being used, try opening this URL https://app.rippling.com/spend-management/dashboard/reimbursement. If it's already logged-in that means it's working fine
4. Notice that the images are not being rendered properly. All these images are being hosted from storage.googleapis.com
5. Try opening dev tools and try fetching any URL from the "storage.googleapis.com" domain. Eg `await fetch("https://storage.googleapis.com/heron-merchant-assets/icons/mrc_BCpmDp2wPo7WWd7Fnuj9Hj.png")`. Notice that all such commands are never resolved or rejected. Also notice that there is no entry in the network panel.
6. The same works fine if using any other profile or simply no profile at all
# Problem Description We are seeing that some images being hosted from storage.googleapis.com are not being rendered. After taking a deeper look, it seems like Chrome never makes any network request for these URLs. Also, the issue is only affecting a subset of our users. When we try changing the profile or signing out of the Chrome profile, the issue doesn't happen any more.
# Summary Chrome not making any network requests to "storage.googleapis.com" domain
# Additional Data Category: Network / Downloading \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Mismatched tag numbers on previous_token
entry.content: This tag number is 90 in Chromium, but 91 in the internal repository. We need them to match so the server can actually use this field.

entry.title: touch-gesture-scroll-page-zoomed with elastic overscroll fails when elastic overscroll is enabled
entry.content: With the feature enabled, the test fails as it is expecting no scrolls, but elastic overscroll allows for scrolling even when there is no page area to scroll.

entry.title: Erro no Java
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem?
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Investigate HighEntropy attribute and Web Preferences API
entry.content:
Investigate if and where the High Entropy IDL attribute [1] should be applied to the Web preferences API.
[1] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/third_party/blink/renderer/bindings/IDLExtendedAttributes.md#HighEntropy

entry.title: Add use counters for Web Preferences API
entry.content: Currently there's no use counters covering the API usage of the Web Preferences API, this should be added as is normal for all APIs.

entry.title: "[M122] Fix crash when selecting search engine with unknown ID" test case coverage needed in Earl Grey or unittests for issue 324879464
entry.content:
dgn@, do we have automation coverage for this bug to prevent future regressions?
Requesting you to provide the automation status / tests links.

entry.title: [V8 Perf Sheriff]: 1 regressions in v8.browsing_mobile-future
entry.content:
All graphs for this regression group at 1261247:1261295:

Regressions grouped by v8.browsing_mobile-future includes data from the following benchmarks with listed owners: v8.browsing_mobile-future: None
Commits in this range:

entry.title: Internals UI erroneously assumes clear-storage operation succeeds
entry.content: When the user initiates a data-clear from the internals UI, the to-be-deleted data is preemptively removed from the UI, but the data-clear may fail, in which case that removal is misleading and won't be correct until the next refresh. There's no need to perform this preemptive removal because a separate Mojo event will be dispatched notifying the UI that there is updated data to fetch.

entry.title: Unwanted popup
entry.content:
Chrome Version : <from chrome://version/> OS : <OS version>
What steps will reproduce the problem?
What is the expected result?
What happens instead?
You can help us a lot by creating a minimal, reproducible example (https://stackoverflow.com/help/minimal-reproducible-example), e.g. on glitch.com, and/or attaching a screenshot or recording of the issue!

entry.title: Update DockingPromoAppAgent for multiple browser states.
Update PostRestoreAppAgent for multiple browser states.
Remove browserProviderInterface property from MainController internals.
Update all feature trackers for external intent launch.
Update background download tasks for multiple browser states.
Update CertificatePolicyAppAgent for multiple browser states.
Rewrite browsing data removal for multi-profile.
entry.content:
Currently browsing data removal is implemented inside MainController, triggered by a command, and includes a 50-line callback block. It also isn't set up for multi-profile.
It should be rewritten as a keyed service which gets browsers via BrowserList.

entry.title: Iterate over all browser states to clean up discarded sessions.
Handle multiple browser states for snapshot cleanup.
Perform favicon cleanup for all browser states.
Valid Xpath expression fails. try at https://www.videlibri.de/cgi-bin/xidelcgi
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. $x(`//*[@id='project-list']/descendant::*[contains(text(), 'The Hitchhiker''s Guide to the Galaxy')]`) 2. 3.
# Problem Description VM59:1 Uncaught DOMException: Failed to execute '$x' on 'CommandLineAPI': The string '//*[@id='project-list']/descendant::*[contains(text(), 'The Hitchhiker''s Guide to the Galaxy')]' is not a valid XPath expression. at <anonymous>:1:1
# Summary Valid Xpath expression fails. try at https://www.videlibri.de/cgi-bin/xidelcgi
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>XML
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Update stored document size logging for multiple browser states, and to not use NSUserDefaults.
Rewrite MainController's session cookie clearing for multiwindow/multi-identity.
Update [MainController scheduleSessionStateCacheCleanup] for multiple browser states.
Update [MainController scheduleAppDistributionPings] for multiple browser states.
Have the search engine updater in MainController track all browser states,
console is clearing automatically after the execution

entry.title: Incognito tab not fully incognito
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Open new incognito tab 2. Visit simple page on localhost that sets via JavaScript a localStorage item 3. Open another tab in incognito 4. Visit simple page and see that localStorage is already set
# Problem Description localStorage should not be shared between incognito tabs for the same domain
# Summary Incognito tab not fully incognito
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Storage
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Rust/Bindgen-related build failure in some build environments
entry.content:
REPRO STEPS:
0. (Speculative/unconfirmed prerequisite) Get a glinux laptop (Lenovo P1G4). (The bug doesn't seem to repro on glinux workstations)
1. `autoninja -C out/Default unit_tests`
EXPECTED BEHAVIOR: build succeeds
ACTUAL BEHAVIOR: bindgen failure (copied from the internal https://paste.googleplex.com/5704500919140352):
``` [693/8502] ACTION //third_party/boringssl:raw_bssl_sys_bindings(//build/toolchain/linux:clang_x64) FAILED: gen/third_party/boringssl/raw_bssl_sys_bindings.rs python3 ../../build/rust/run_bindgen.py --exe ../../third_party/rust-toolchain/bin/bindgen --header ../../third_party/boringssl/src/rust/bssl-sys/wrapper.h --depfile obj/third_party/boringssl/raw_bssl_sys_bindings.d --output gen/third_party/boringssl/raw_bssl_sys_bindings.rs --libclang-path ../../third_party/rust-toolchain/lib --bindgen-flags no-derive-default enable-function-attribute-detection use-core default-macro-constant-type=signed blocklist-function=BIO_vsnprintf blocklist-function=OPENSSL_vasprintf rustified-enum=point_conversion_form_t allowlist-file=.\*\[\[:punct:\]\]include\[\[:punct:\]\]openssl\[\[:punct:\]\].\*\\.h allowlist-file=.\*\[\[:punct:\]\]rust_wrapper\\.h -- -DDCHECK_ALWAYS_ON=1 -DUSE_UDEV -DUSE_AURA=1 -DUSE_OZONE=1 -D__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS -D__STDC_FORMAT_MACROS -D_FILE_OFFSET_BITS=64 -D_LARGEFILE_SOURCE -D_LARGEFILE64_SOURCE -D_GNU_SOURCE -D_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE=_LIBCPP_HARDENING_MODE_EXTENSIVE -DCR_CLANG_REVISION=\"llvmorg-18-init-17730-gf670112a-3\" -DCOMPONENT_BUILD -DCR_LIBCXX_REVISION=9d119c1f4a097b7d27210874f4eba3fc91a83a4e -DCR_SYSROOT_KEY=20230611T210420Z-2 -DOS_CHROMEOS -D_DEBUG -DDYNAMIC_ANNOTATIONS_ENABLED=1 -DBORINGSSL_SHARED_LIBRARY -I../.. -Igen -I../../buildtools/third_party/libc++ -I../../third_party/boringssl/src/include -Wall -Wextra -Wimplicit-fallthrough -Wextra-semi -Wunreachable-code-aggressive -Wthread-safety -Wno-missing-field-initializers -Wno-unused-parameter -Wno-psabi -Wloop-analysis -Wno-unneeded-internal-declaration -Wenum-compare-conditional -Wno-ignored-pragma-optimize -Wno-deprecated-builtins -Wno-bitfield-constant-conversion -Wno-deprecated-this-capture -Wno-invalid-offsetof -Wno-vla-extension -Wno-thread-safety-reference-return -Wshadow -Werror -fno-delete-null-pointer-checks -fno-ident -fno-strict-aliasing -funwind-tables -fPIC -pthread -fcolor-diagnostics -fmerge-all-constants -fcrash-diagnostics-dir=../../tools/clang/crashreports -mllvm -instcombine-lower-dbg-declare=0 -mllvm -split-threshold-for-reg-with-hint=0 -ffp-contract=off -m64 -msse3 -Wno-builtin-macro-redefined -D__DATE__= -D__TIME__= -D__TIMESTAMP__= -ffile-compilation-dir=. -no-canonical-prefixes -ftrivial-auto-var-init=zero -O0 -fno-omit-frame-pointer -gdwarf-4 -g2 -gdwarf-aranges -gsplit-dwarf -ggnu-pubnames -Xclang -fuse-ctor-homing -fvisibility=hidden -Xclang -add-plugin -Xclang find-bad-constructs -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ref-template-as-trivial-member -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-stack-allocated -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-allow-auto-typedefs -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-raw-ptr-to-stack-allocated -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ptr-exclude-path=/third_party/dawn/ -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ptr-exclude-path=base/logging.h -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ptr-exclude-path=base/synchronization/lock_impl.h -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang raw-ptr-exclude-path=base/check.h -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-ipc -Xclang -plugin-arg-find-bad-constructs -Xclang check-raw-ptr-fields -Wheader-hygiene -Wstring-conversion -Wtautological-overlap-compare -std=c11 --sysroot=../../build/linux/debian_bullseye_amd64-sysroot -resource-dir ../../third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/lib/clang/18 -fparse-all-comments -fvisibility=default error: unsupported option '-msse3' for target 'unit_tests' error: unknown target triple 'unit_tests' panicked at bindgen/ir/context.rs:553:15: libclang error; possible causes include: - Invalid flag syntax - Unrecognized flags - Invalid flag arguments - File I/O errors - Host vs. target architecture mismatch If you encounter an error missing from this list, please file an issue or a PR! ```

entry.title: [User Feedback - Early Stable] Reports that Chrome does not open as expected on Windows in M122 early stable
entry.content:
Affected Chrome Version(s): 122.0.6261.18 beta, 122.0.6261.39
Affected Operating Systems: 10.0.19045, 10.0.22621, 10.0.22631
Issue Description + Insights/Patterns: We have a small number of feedback reports from Windows users on M122 early stable sharing that Chrome is not opening as expected. From the report details, it sounds like Chrome may be starting in the background or without an open window, as several users mention Chrome is running when checking the Windows task manager.
* Most reports mention that opening via an existing desktop or taskbar shortcut doesn't work as expected, with no Chrome windows opening. * Some reports mention that right-clicking an existing taskbar shortcut and selecting the "open new window" option allows Chrome to open as expected. * One report mentions that opening Chrome as an administrator allows Chrome to open as expected. Another report mentions that opening as administrator doesn’t work. * One report mentions that after trying to open via a shortcut and not seeing it open, when checking the Windows task manager they noticed that two Chrome processes were running. * There is no clear regional / country pattern.
Highlighted User Voice Examples (Access: http://shortn/_0E2VFlfXQ2): * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564473861 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91563768374 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564614049 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91542026515 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564108352 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91564051186 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565094679 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565408738 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91565574256 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91566011302 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91566026152 * https://listnr.corp.google.com/report/91566087093
Thanks!
